item.title: Jerry Rigging
item.description: A blend of ‘jury-rigged’ and ‘jerry-built’ meaning to make a makeshift repair or construct something quickly using only materials at hand.

item.title: Jugaad
item.description: A Hindi term for a flexible, innovative, and resourceful approach to problem-solving that emphasizes using limited resources to create quick fixes or frugal innovations.

item.title: Kludge
item.description: A workaround or makeshift solution that is clumsy, inelegant, and hard to maintain, but rapidly solves an important problem using available resources.

item.title: Deductive Reasoning - Eliminate the Impossible
item.description: When you have eliminated the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth.

item.title: Inversion
item.description: Looking at a problem or decision from the opposite point of view to avoid failure rather than achieve success.
